content.text: Just as in plants, there are two modes by which animals reproduce. These are: (i) Sexual reproduction, and (ii) Asexual reproduction.
The male reproductive organs include a pair of testes (singular, testis), two sperm ducts and a penis (Fig. 6.1).

content.caption: Fig. 6.1: Male reproductive organs in humans

content.text: The female reproductive organs are a pair of ovaries, oviducts (fallopian tubes) and the uterus (Fig. 6.3).

content.caption: Fig. 6.3: Female reproductive organs in humans

content.text: The first step in the process of reproduction is the fusion of a sperm and an ovum. When sperms come in contact with an egg, one of the sperms may fuse with the egg.
